questions.question_text_1: Consider the following two statements and select the correct option.  Statement 1: Server-level logging can only indicate which URLs were accessed Statement 2: Server-level logging can indicate if large number of requests were made in a short duration of time such as in DDoS attacks
question_texts: Consider the following two statements and select the correct option.  Statement 1: Server-level logging can only indicate which URLs were accessed Statement 2: Server-level logging can indicate if large number of requests were made in a short duration of time such as in DDoS attacks

options.option_text: Statement 1 is true, while statement 2 is false
Statement 2 is true, while statement 1 is false

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following statements about HTML4 and HTML5 and select the correct option.  Statement 1: The HTML gets separated out from SGML from its fourth version, HTML4. Statement 2: HTML5 has additional support for latest features like multimedia support, canvases etc. and it has its own parsing rules.
question_texts: Consider the following statements about HTML4 and HTML5 and select the correct option.  Statement 1: The HTML gets separated out from SGML from its fourth version, HTML4. Statement 2: HTML5 has additional support for latest features like multimedia support, canvases etc. and it has its own parsing rules.

options.option_text: Statement 1 is correct but statement 2 is incorrect.
Statement 2 is correct but statement 1 is incorrect.

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following statements and select the correct option.  Statement 1: Replication is used to improve performance and decrease server load. Statement 2: Redundancy ensures data is not lost if a copy gets destroyed.
question_texts: Consider the following statements and select the correct option.  Statement 1: Replication is used to improve performance and decrease server load. Statement 2: Redundancy ensures data is not lost if a copy gets destroyed.

options.option_text: Statement 1 is true & statement 2 is false
Statement 2 is true & statement 1 is false

questions.question_text_1: Read the following statements regarding web accessibility principles and choose the correct option.  Statement 1: Understandable information and users interface helps developers to avoid and correct mistakes in their content. Statement 2: Perceivable information ensures that the content does not cause any seizures and physical reaction to its users.
question_texts: Read the following statements regarding web accessibility principles and choose the correct option.  Statement 1: Understandable information and users interface helps developers to avoid and correct mistakes in their content. Statement 2: Perceivable information ensures that the content does not cause any seizures and physical reaction to its users.

options.option_text: Both statement 1 and statement 2 are correct.
Both statement 1 and statement 2 are incorrect
Statement 1 is correct but statement 2 is incorrect
Statement 1 is incorrect but statement 2 is correct
A customer can exist without having any orders
An order can exist without belonging to any customer
A customer needs to have at least one order
An order must belong to one and only one customer

questions.question_text_1: Consider a discourse forum where a user unlocks the ability to post images once he makes more than 25 posts. What kind of access control is this?
question_texts: Consider a discourse forum where a user unlocks the ability to post images once he makes more than 25 posts. What kind of access control is this?

options.option_text: Both role-based and attribute-based access control

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following statements regarding Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment and select the correct option.   Statement 1: As part of continuous integration, frequent, isolated changes are tested and reported on as soon as they are added to a larger code base. Statement 2: When a change is made to an application, it is automatically deployed into production using a continuous deployment strategy.
question_texts: Consider the following statements regarding Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment and select the correct option.   Statement 1: As part of continuous integration, frequent, isolated changes are tested and reported on as soon as they are added to a larger code base. Statement 2: When a change is made to an application, it is automatically deployed into production using a continuous deployment strategy.

props.summary: Here’s a structured **summary of core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** for the **"Diploma Level: Modern Application Development 1"** exam, along with **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- ## **1. Core Topics & Concepts** ### **A. Web Development (HTML, Flask, Jinja2)** #### **Key Concepts:** 1. **HTML Attributes & Accessibility** - `alt` attribute in ``: Provides alternative text for accessibility (e.g., screen readers) or when the image fails to load. - Semantic HTML5: Supports multimedia (`
